title: Northern Territory mining
creator_contributor_role: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, production company
subject_group: Agriculture, Business, Commerce & Industry/Mineral industries - Australia - History
Agriculture, Business, Commerce & Industry/Mines and mineral resources - Australia
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Mining districts - Social aspects
description: Minerals of all kinds have a key role to play in Australian development. Peko Mines at Tennant Creek and ore deposits in the surrounding areas of Juno, Ivanhoe and Orlando; iron ore deposits south of Darwin; bauxite prospecting at Gove; manganese production by Groot Eylandt Mining Company; and potential oil and gas deposits in the Amadeus Basin, are attracting capital investment and resulting in new centres of population being established.
